string-array.name: introduction_message
string-array.item: 1.In Sudoku, you place a number from 1 to 9 in each blank cell.

2.Each rows (there are nine rows), and columns (there are also nine columes) contain numbers from 1 through 9.\n\n 3.Also, 3x3 blocks bounded by bold lines (nine blocks) contain numbers from 1 through 9.

4.This is an example of answer. Lock at each row. Each cell in the line contains numbers 1 through 9.

 5.Please check each column also contain every number from 1 to 9.

 6.And, each 3x3 block contains numbers from 1 to 9.

7.Since, as for the 3x3 block on the right hand-side, 1 is already contained in the upper row and third row at the left, therefore, 1 is not placed in the cell.\n\n 8.Would be the only red cell that wounld contain 1.
10.There are many more tips.Try discovering your own as you go along.
